meanings.sent1: The saccular shape of the balloon made it easy to carry around.
meanings.sent2: The doctor described the growth as saccular, like a small pouch.
meanings.sent3: The saccular appearance of the cloud reminded me of a fluffy pillow.
meanings.sent4: Her saccular purse seemed to hold an endless amount of items.
meanings.sent5: The saccular design of the building made it stand out among the rest.

meanings.definition: Having a sac or pouch-like structure
meanings.sent1: The saccular plant stored water in its pouch-like leaves.
meanings.sent2: The saccular organ in the fish helped with buoyancy control.
meanings.sent3: The saccular pockets in the jacket were perfect for storing snacks.
meanings.sent4: The saccular structure of the hive provided a safe space for the bees.
meanings.sent5: The saccular shape of the nest protected the eggs from harm.
